metadata.Title: CVE-2018-11710 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
soundlib/pattern.h in libopenmpt before 0.3.9 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted AMS file because of an invalid write near address 0 in an out-of-memory situation. It was discovered that OpenMPT incorrectly handled certain files. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-11710` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenmpt-modplug1 - 0.3.9-1
libopenmpt0 - 0.3.9-1
openmpt123 - 0.3.9-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libopenmpt package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.3.9-1').
